taskGroup.name: Language Buddy Quick Tips
taskGroup.intro: Introduction These tips will help you to learn how to use Language Buddy.
taskGroup.onCompletion: Conclusion Hopefully you know have a better idea how to use Language Buddy. For more information please see Help or the web site.

taskGroup.name: Getting Started
taskGroup.intro: Introduction This tip will walk you through creating a User Project and creating your first Language Module.
taskGroup.onCompletion: Conclusion You have now set up your own User Project and created your first Language Module.

task.name: Create a New User
task.intro: Introduction Create a New User Project. Each user of Language Buddy should create their own User Project otherwise test results will get confused.
task.onCompletion: Conclusion You should now be able to see your name in the Navigator view.

task.name: Create a folder
task.intro: Introduction It is often useful to store Test Modules in folders and sub-folders.
task.onCompletion: Conclusion You can now add more folders in the same way, which can be sub-folders of the one you have just created or Folders at the top level of your project.

task.name: New Language Module
task.intro: Introduction This walks you through the process of creating a Language Module.
task.onCompletion: Conclusion You should now have created your first Language Module. You can now create more modules or start a test.

task.name: Searching
task.intro: Introduction Once you have created several Test Modules it is useful to be able to search them for words in either your own language or the language which you are learning.
task.onCompletion: Conclusion You can now search by in multiple languages and by tags.

task.name: Tagging
task.intro: Introduction You can add Tags to Test Items to make it easier to find items in different modules. These can highlight different properties such as grammar, level of difficulty or topic.
task.onCompletion: Conclusion You can now know how to create tags, apply them to Test Items, use them to search for Test Items and filter your tests.

task.name: Using data from other sources
task.intro: Introduction This CheatSheet will guide you how to copy data into a Language Module from a spreadsheet.
task.onCompletion: Conclusion You can now import data from a spreadsheet or other table into Language Buddy.

task.name: Viewing Test Results
task.intro: Introduction This Cheat Sheet shows you how to see your Test results and graph them.

task.name: Exporting
task.intro: Introduction This CheatSheet will guide you through exporting your data into PDF, HTML or CSV.

task.name: Additional Languages
task.intro: Introduction This Cheat Sheet will explain how to add extra languages to your workspace.
task.onCompletion: Conclusion You can now add multiple languages or different script variants and use them in your Language Modules.
